title: U.S. household expenditure on hair care products 2007 to 2018
yAxis: Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars, with a total of 12 data points. The chart has 3 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2012.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2010 to 2007.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2012 to 2010.
gold: The amount spent on hair care products annually varies over the years in the United States . In 2018 , American consumers spent between 73.4 U.S. dollars in a year on hair care products . Where Americans Buy Cosmetics According to a 2017 survey , over half of Americans have bought cosmetics from a Walmart or Walmart Supercenter , a higher share than any other retailer in the United States .
